Posts.Content: Good morning Jenny and Del.   I hope you don't mind me popping into your group but I spotted this post about sore mouth / throat and as I had treatment for mouth cancer I understand this all too well ! Yes, you can indeed buy the Difflam mouth rinse from the chemists but it does cost so try and get it on prescription .... occasionally I bought it when necessary, but ask the pharmacist for the bigger bottle ( they keep it in the actual pharmacy bit ) The regular smaller bottle doesn't go very far, hope this helps. Joycee x
Posts.Title: sore mouth and throat
How to stop / deal with religious comments

Posts.Content: Ladies ...... for those interested, there is a group on the site where the posting of these discussions would be more suitable. Click on the Group tab and go to Cancer Experiences ....... on the first page you will find ' A group ONLY for Atheists, Agnostics, etc ... ' part way down.
Posts.Title: How to stop / deal with religious comments
